interestingcomments.content:
Career choices /!/ So I’m a 20 yr old male with a good head on my shoulders and very good work ethic blah blah blah. I’ve been looking into the reality that tech will keep evolving and I love data. Information and analyzing it. More so I enjoy putting data to work... I love looking at data and seeing what it tells us about the world society and economy. However, I don’t know much about computers or programming or anything like that. I’m good enough with math but I can’t break the barrier to enter and start doing things. I also have the problem where I don’t care what I do as long as it contains the following: 

Makes a societal contribution or gives me the ability to help people 
     -definitely looking at fields that require innovation 
 
A lot of movement flexibility or excitement 

Would like to either start a business based off of what I do or aids me in starting a business 


currently I’m entering my sophomore year at community college studying business. I’m very active in my community with politics and government (one of my biggest interests). I also work at a garden center which I enjoy very much and am even considering it to be what I focus on for a bit to see the potential data science has in anything to do with specifically agriculture or horticulture. 

My questions:
Does it sound like data science would be for me based on my priorities? 

How can I begin learning to use tools and involve myself in the data science community?

Is it worth going to school for if it’s not the main focus of my career or should I just teach myself/ take courses online? 

Any comments or suggestions are welcome :)
